book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.ad:
The [#](AA00AA)Advanced Incubator[#]() is an upgrade to the [Incubator](entry://blocks/incubator). \
  \
Like the Incubator, it functions as a Brewing Stand. However, the Advanced Incubator has a temperature mechanic. \
  \
The coil on the left of the GUI can be clicked to toggle between low and high temperatures.

By default, it's [#](FF5555)120 times slower[#]() at low-temperature. This means a single brew takes a full 20 minutes, excluding Overclockers. \
  \
The reason you'd *want* to use low temperature mode is that that's the only way you can get [Genetically Modified Cells](entry://items/potion_cell_growth@gmo_cell)

[Genetically Modified Cells](entry://items/potion_cell_growth@gmo_cell) are [#](00AAAA)guaranteed to have a specific Gene[#](), if crafted correctly. \
  \
Each GM Cell has its own recipe, with a [#](FF5555)chance of failure[#](). \
  \
The recipe for this GM Cell, for example, has a 30%% chance of success by default.

Each Overclocker [#](FF5555)decreases the chance by 10%%[#](). \
  \
However, you can insert [#](00AAAA)Chorus Fruit[#]() into the top right slot to increase your odds! \
  \
By default, each Chorus Fruit increases the chance by 10%%. The Advanced Incubator will up as many Chorus Fruit as it takes to reach 100%.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.an:
The [#](AA00AA)Anti-Field Block[#]() allows you to [#](00AAAA)temporarily disable certain Genes[#](). \
  \
Specifically, it disabled the [Item Attraction Field](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/item_magnet) and [XP Attraction Field](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/xp_magnet) when enabled. \
  \
The [Anti-Field Orb](entry://items/anti_field_orb) functions similarly, but in item form.

The Anti-Field Block is active by default, and can be disabled with a Redstone signal. \
  \
While active, it disables all Fields within a 25 block spherical radius. This amount is configurable.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.bl: The [#](AA00AA)Blood Purifier[#]() uses FE to decontaminate [Syringes](entry://items/syringe).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.ce: The [#](AA00AA)Cell Analyzer[#]() uses FE to convert [Organic Matter](entry://items/organic_matter) into [Cells](entry://items/cell).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.co:
The [#](AA00AA)Coal Generator[#]() burns furnace fuels to generate FE. \
  \
Furnace fuels that burn longer produce more FE. \
  \
The amount is configurable, but defaults to 6FE/t. With this, [#](00AAAA)1 Coal generates 9,600 FE[#]().
If the Coal Generator fills up with fuel burning, it [#](00AAAA)pauses until it has room for more energy[#](), preventing waste!
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.dn:
The [#](AA00AA)DNA Decryptor[#]() uses FE to decrypt encrypted [DNA Helices](entry://items/dna_helix). \
  \
Every time DNA is decrypted, it will choose a [Gene](category://genes), based on the Entity the Helix came from. \
  \
This Gene is weighted, some Genes have a higher chance than others. The Gene is chosen at the start of the process.
If the Decryptor isn't working and there's a DNA Helix in the output slot, try taking it out. The next Gene may be of a different type, which means it can't stack with the one in the output slot.
The [#](AA00AA)DNA Extractor[#]() uses FE to convert [Cells](entry://items/cell) into encrypted [DNA Helices](entry://items/dna_helix).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.in: The [#](AA00AA)Incubator[#]() is effectively a faster Brewing Stand. It runs at twice the speed, but [#](FF5555)costs FE instead of Blaze Powder[#]().
It speed can be increased with [Overclockers](entry://items/overclocker).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.blocks.pl:
The [#](AA00AA)Plasmid Infuser[#]() uses FE to infuse [DNA Helices](entry://items/dna_helix) into a [Plasmid](entry://items/plasmid). \
  \
Insert an empty Plasmid in the right slot, and a DNA Helix in the left slot. \
  \
The DNA Helix will be used up, and set the Plasmid's Gene to match the Helix's.

Each Gene requires a certain amount of [#](00AAAA)DNA Points[#]() for the Plasmid to be completed. \
  \
- Basic Genes are worth 1 point.
- Genes of the Plasmid's type are worth 2 points. \
  \
A Basic Gene cannot be the first one infused into a Plasmid.

The [#](AA00AA)Plasmid Injector[#]() uses FE to inject completed [Plasmids](entry://items/plasmid) into a [Syringe](entry://items/syringe). \
  \
You can inject as many Plasmids into a single Syringe as you want.

The Syringe must be full of uncompromised blood. \
  \
Decontaminate blood in the [Blood Purifier](entry://blocks/blood_purifier).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.genes.gen: The [#](AA00AA)Bioluminescence[#]() Gene causes entities to [#](00AAAA)spawn light sources[#]() when in the dark.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Chatterbox[#]() Gene causes your chat messages to be [#](00AAAA)read by the game's narrator[#](). \
  \
This only applies to players within 64 blocks of you, and can be disabled in the client config.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Chilling[#]() Gene makes your melee attacks have a chance of [#](00AAAA)inflicting a buildup of Freezing[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Claws[#]() Gene gives entities a chance to [#](00AAAA)inflict Bleeding[#]() on empty-handed melee attacks. \
  \
When mutated into Claws II, the chance is doubled.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Dragon's Breath[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)shoot a dragon fireball[#]() when the "Dragon's Breath" keybind is pressed. \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 15 seconds.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Eat Grass[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)right-click Grass Blocks to regain hunger[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Efficiency[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)makes players mine faster[#](). This stacks with enchantments and the Haste effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Efficiency IV[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Emerald Heart[#]() Gene causes entities to [#](00AAAA)drop an Emerald upon death[#](). \
  \
For players, this has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 60 seconds.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Ender Dragon Health[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)completely negate damage[#]() while a [Dragon Health Crystal](entry://items/dragon_health_crystal) is in their inventory. \
  \
Any damage they would take is instead dealt to the Crystal's durability.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Explosive Exit[#]() Gene causes entities to [#](00AAAA)explode upon death[#](). \
  \
If a player has this Gene, they only explode if they have 5 Gunpowder in their inventory, which is removed upon detonation.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Fire Proof[#]() Gene makes entities [#](00AAAA) completely immune to fire damage[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Flight[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)fly[#]() by double-tapping jump. \
  \
By default, this Gene requires the following other Genes:
- [Teleport](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/teleport)
- [Jump Boost](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/jump_boost)
- [No Fall Damage](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/no_fall_damage)
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Haste[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Haste[#]() effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Haste II[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Infinity[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)fire Arrows when none are in their inventory[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Invisible[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Invisibility[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Item Attraction Field[#]() Gene causes players to [#](00AAAA)grab items from much larger distances[#](). \
  \
This Gene is disabled when the player has an active [Anti-Field Orb](entry://items/anti_field_orb), is near an active [Anti-Field Block](entry://blocks/anti_field_block), or when sneaking.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Johnny[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)increases your attack damage when using Axes[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Jump Boost[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Jump Boost[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Keep Inventory[#]() Gene causes players to [#](00AAAA)keep their inventory upon death[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Lay Egg[#]() Gene causes entities to [#](00AAAA)spawn an Egg[#]() every so often. \
  \
This time is configurable, but defaults to once every 5 minutes.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Luck[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Luck[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Meaty[#]() Gene allows entities to be [#](00AAAA)sheared for a Raw Porkchop[#](). \
  \
If a player has it, they can shear themselves by sneak right-clicking with Shears. \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, but defaults to once every minute.
This can be mutated into Meaty II, which causes the entity to [#](00AAAA)drop a Cooked Porkchop[#]() once every 5 minutes.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Milky[#]() Gene allows entities to [#](00AAAA)be milked with a Bucket[#](). \
  \
If a player has it, they can milk themselves by sneak right-clicking with a Bucket. \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 1 tick.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Mob Sight[#]() Gene occasionally [#](00AAAA)gives all nearby mobs the Glowing effect[#](). \
  \
Both the cooldown and radius are configurable, defaulting to 1 second and 32 blocks respectively.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)More Hearts[#]() Gene gives entities [#](00AAAA)10 extra hearts[#](). \
  \
This can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)More Hearts II[#](), which gives [#](00AAAA)an additional 10 hearts[#](), for +20 hearts in total.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Night Vision[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Night Vision[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)No Fall Damage[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)negates all fall damage[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)No Hunger[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)prevents hunger from draining[#]() below a specific point, which defaults to halfway.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Photosynthesis[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)feeds the player when they're in direct sunlight[#]().
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Poison Immunity[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)makes entities immune to Poison[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Regeneration[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Regeneration[#]() effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Regeneration IV[#](), which gives the [#](00AAAA)Regeneration IV[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Resistance[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Resistance[#]() effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Resistance II[#](), which gives the [#](00AAAA)Resistance II[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Scare Creepers[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)causes Creepers to run away from you[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Scare Skeletons[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)causes Skeletons to run away from you[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Scare Spiders[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)causes Spiders to run away from you[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Scare Zombies[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)causes Zombies to run away from you[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Shoot Fireballs[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)shoot Fireballs[#]() when a Blaze Rod is used.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Slimy Death[#]() Gene makes it so, [#](00AAAA)upon the player dying, they are instantly revived and several friendly Support Slimes spawn[#](). \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 5 minutes.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Speed[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Speed[#]() effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Speed II[#]() and [#](AA00AA)Speed IV[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Step Assist[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)walk up single blocks[#]() as if they were stairs.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Strength[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Strength[#]() effect. \
  \
Can be mutated into [#](AA00AA)Strength II[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Teleport[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)teleport forward[#]() when the "Teleport" keybind is pressed. \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 1 second. The distance is also configurable, defaulting to 10 blocks.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Thorns[#]() Gene [#](00AAAA)reflects damage back to the attacker[#](). This uses up some hunger
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Climb Walls[#]() Gene allows players to [#](00AAAA)climb up walls[#](). \
  \
You can hold sneak to stop climbing.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Water Breathing[#]() Gene gives entities the [#](00AAAA)Water Breathing[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Wither Hit[#]() Gene causes entities to [#](00AAAA)inflict Wither when melee attacking[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Wither Proof[#]() Gene makes entities [#](00AAAA)immune to Wither[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Wooly[#]() Gene allows entities to [#](00AAAA)be sheared for Wool[#](). \
  \
If a player has it, they can shear themselves by sneak right-clicking with Shears. \
  \
This has a configurable cooldown, with the default being 1 minute.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)XP Attraction Field[#]() Gene causes players to [#](00AAAA)grab XP Orbs from much larger distances[#](). \
  \
This Gene is disabled when the player has an active [Anti-Field Orb](entry://items/anti_field_orb), is near an active [Anti-Field Block](entry://blocks/anti_field_block), or when sneaking.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.getting_s: Getting Genes is a rather involved process.

First, you'll need the [Scraper](entry://items/scraper). This tool can be used on entities to collect [Organic Matter](entry://items/organic_matter) from them. \
  \
The Organic Matter will have the entity's type attached. This is what decides what Genes you can get from it.

[#](AA00AA)Genes[#]() can be taken from mobs to [#](00AAAA)harness their abilities[#](). \
  \
For example, Sheep have the [Wooly](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/wooly) Gene. If you inject this into yourself, you will be able to be sheared for wool! \
  \
To see a full list of Genes, [see here](category://genes).

Each Gene page in the book will say what the Gene does. As for how to get it, the mod has [EMI](https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/emi) integration. \
  \
Some Genes can even be given to mobs!
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.ant:
The [#](AA00AA)Anti-Field Orb[#]() allows you to [#](00AAAA)temporarily disable certain Genes[#](). \
  \
Specifically, it disables the [Item Attraction Field](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/item_magnet) and [XP Attraction Field](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/xp_magnet) when enabled.
The Anti-Field Orb can be toggled by right-clicking it while held.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.cel:
[#](AA00AA)Cells[#]() are a recipe ingredient used in the creation of [DNA Helices](entry://items/dna_helix). \
  \
This is done in the [DNA Extractor](entry://blocks/dna_extractor).

Each entity has its own Cell, which can be processed into a [DNA Helix](entry://items/dna_helix) of the entity's type. \
  \
You can see the Cell's entity type in the item's tooltip.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.dna:
[#](AA00AA)DNA Helices[#]() contain genetic information. This can be either in the form of [Genes](category://genes) or an [#](00AAAA)entity type[#]() \
  \
Freshly crafted, a DNA Helix contains only the Entity that the DNA came from.

This DNA Helix contains the genetic information of a [#](00AAAA)Cow[#](), but the actual Gene it has is [#](FF5555)unknown[#](). \
  \
To decrypt it, you'll need to pass it through a [DNA Decryptor](entry://blocks/dna_decryptor).
This DNA Helix has been decrypted, and now we can see it contains the [Milky](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/milky) Gene.
DNA Helices have a chance of being [#](00AAAA)Basic[#](). This means that they [#](FF5555)don't contain any Gene[#](), but they can still contribute to [Plasmids](entry://items/plasmid).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.dra:
The [#](AA00AA)Dragon Health Crystal[#]() is part of the [Ender Dragon Health](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/ender_dragon_health) Gene. \
  \
While you have that Gene, and while holding a Dragon Health Crystal, any incoming damage is negated and instead dealt to the Crystal.
A fresh Dragon health Crystal has [#](00AAAA)1,000 durability[#](). Each half-heart deals 1 point of durability damage. It can be repaired with End Crystals.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.org:
Organic Matter is a recipe ingredient used in the creation of [Cells](entry://items/cell). \
  \
This is done in the [Cell Analyzer](entry://blocks/cell_analyzer).

Each entity has its own Organic Matter, which can be processed into a [Cell](entry://items/cell) of the entity's type. \
  \
You can see the Organic Matter's entity type in the item's tooltip.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.ove:
The [#](AA00AA)Overclocker[#]() can be inserted into most of the mod's machines to [#](00AAAA)massively increase their speed[#](). \
  \
Each Overclocker doubles the speed, but increases the power draw by a quarter.
You can have [#](00AAAA)up to 8 Overclockers[#]() in a machine.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.pan: [#](AA00AA)Panacea[#]() is a simple potion: It cures all negative effects, and [#](00AAAA)removes all negative Genes[#]().
Sure, you could do the same with a Bucket of Milk and an Anti-Plasmid, but this is much more convenient, sometimes, maybe.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.pla:
[#](AA00AA)Plasmids[#]() are the vehicle that carries [Genes](category://genes). \
  \
Plasmids default as [#](FF5555)empty[#](), with no genetic information. \
  \
To begin, use a [Plasmid Infuser](entry://blocks/plasmid_infuser) to infuse a decrypted DNA Helix into them. \
  \
This will set the Plasmid's Gene.

Plasmids require a certain amount of [#](00AAAA)Gene Points[#]() to be complete. \
  \
The amount of Gene Points required depends on the Plasmid's Gene. More advanced Genes cost more Points.

This Plasmid has been infused with the [Scare Creepers](entry://genes/geneticsresequenced/scare_creepers) Gene. \
  \
Notice, however, that it [#](FF5555)only contains 1 Gene Point[#](). \
  \
Infusing more DNA Helices of the same Gene will add +2 Points each, while Basic Genes will add +1 each.

Once it's reached its maximum Gene Points required, the Plasmid will be marked [#](00AAAA)complete[#]()! \
  \
That means it's ready to be injected into a Syringe at the [Plasmid Injector](entry://blocks/plasmid_injector).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.pot:
[#](AA00AA)Potions of Cell Growth[#](), like Organic Substrate, has no effect when imbibed. It's more of a crafting ingredient than a potion. \
  \
These recipes allow you to [#](00AAAA)improve your odds of getting certain rare Genes[#]().
A [Cell](entry://items/cell) can be brewed into the Potion of Cell Growth to [#](00AAAA)set the Potion to the Cell's entity type[#]().
From there, certain entity types have recipes to make [#](AA00AA)Genetically Modified Cells[#](), which are guaranteed to give a specific Gene.

A low-temperature Advanced Incubator takes a very long time, but can be accelerated using Overclockers. \
  \
Unfortunately, Overclockers lower your chances of success. Chorus Fruits increase it back, though!

The [#](AA00AA)Potion of Mutation[#]() is used to craft [Genetically Modified Cells](entry://items/potion_cell_growth@gmo_cell) that are set to [#](00AAAA)mutation Genes[#](). \
  \
Mutation Genes are effectively just [#](00AAAA)more powerful[#]() Genes, and generally [#](FF5555)require other Genes[#]().
Like [Potions of Cell Growth](entry://items/potion_cell_growth), to make GM Cells, you have to process through a low-temperature [Advanced Incubator](entry://blocks/advanced_incubator).
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.scr:
The [#](AA00AA)Scraper[#]() is used to get [Organic Matter](entry://items/organic_matter) from mobs. \
  \
To use it, simply right-click the mob. This damages the mob, which counts as an attack and will anger neutral entities.
The Scraper can be enchanted with [#](00AAAA)Delicate Touch[#]() to prevent damaging and angering entities.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.syr:
The [#](AA00AA)Syringe[#]() is used to [#](00AAAA)extract and inject blood[#](). Simply hold right-click, and the process will end automatically. \
  \
The reason you'd *want* to extract blood is that that's what carries completed [Plasmids](entry://items/plasmid) back into your body.

When you extract blood, it'll be [#](FF5555)contaminated[#](). You'll need to clean it in the [Blood Purifier](entry://blocks/blood_purifier) before it can be used. \
  \
Plasmids are added in the [Plasmid Injector](entry://blocks/plasmid_injector).

You can also use the [#](AA00AA)Metal Syringe[#](), which targets others instead of yourself! \
  \
This is how you would give Genes to entities.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.vir:
[#](AA00AA)Viral Agents[#]() are the final crafting potion of the mod. They are used to craft [negative Genes](category://genes/negative), which are generally just any gene that's harmful. \
  \
Negative Genes are always lost on death, regardless of config setting. Additionally, there's a config to prevent players from even being able to get negative Genes in the first place.
Virus Cultivation recipes can be crafted in the Brewing Stand or in either Incubator.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.items.zom: A [#](AA00AA)Potion of Zombify Villager[#]() does right what it says on the tin: it turns Villagers into Zombie Villagers.
Obviously, it's best utilized in Splash form.
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.name: Big Book of Genetics
book.geneticsresequenced.guide.negative_: The [#](AA00AA)Bad Omen[#]() gives entities the [#](FF5555)Bad Omen[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Black Death[#]() Plague Gene [#](FF5555)instantly kills whoever has it[#](). Given its strength, this Gene is much harder to acquire than others. \
  \
To craft its DNA Helix, you'll need to get a [#](00AAAA)Syringe with **every other negative gene** in the game[#](). This includes other Plagues, but not disabled Genes. \
  \
From there, simply brew that Syringe into a Potion of Viral Agents.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Cringe[#]() gives [#](00AAAA)uwufies your chat messages[#](), and sets your language to LOLCAT. \
  \
That second feature can be disabled in the client config.
This Gene [#](FF5555)cannot be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Cursed[#]() gives entities the [#](FF5555)Bad Luck[#]() effect.
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Flambé[#]() gene [#](FF5555)constantly lights entities on fire[#]().
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().
The [#](AA00AA)Gray Death[#]() Plague Gene [#](FF5555)kills any entity that can age[#]()
This Gene [#](00AAAA)can be given to mobs[#]().

modonomicon.command.error.load_progress_: Failed to decode unlock code. Make sure to have a valid unlock code in your clipboard! Current Clipboard content: "%s"

modonomicon.gui.bookmarks.info:
To navigate to a bookmark, click on it in this list.
\
\
To add a bookmark, open an entry and click the "Add Bookmark" button on the bottom right.
\
\
To remove a bookmark, navigate to it and click the "Remove Bookmark" button on the bottom right.
